That's great to hear! It's always exciting to try out new skills and gear on the water. Practicing your casting skills will definitely help you prepare for your trip, and getting insight from local fishermen or guides will give you a better understanding of the river's conditions and trout behavior.

Remember to also check the weather forecast and plan your trip accordingly. Weather conditions can greatly affect the fishing, and it's always better to be prepared.

As you're planning your trip, you might want to consider the following:

* Make sure you have the right gear and tackle for the type of fishing you'll be doing.
* Bring appropriate clothing and layers for the weather conditions.
* Pack a first-aid kit and any other essential items, such as sunscreen and insect repellent.
* Respect the environment and other anglers, and always follow local regulations and catch-and-release guidelines.

It's also important to remember to stay safe while fishing. Make sure you're aware of your surroundings, and take necessary precautions to avoid accidents.

I hope you have a great time on your trip and catch some nice trout!
